signature: TransformedMap<K, V> transformingMap(Map<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)

enhanced_by.method_name: transformedMap(Map<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)
enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require a map and transformers for key and value, making them suitable for similar test setup.
The transformMap method is used internally to transform the map, similar to the transformation logic in transformingMap.
The put method is used to insert transformed key-value pairs into the map, similar to the behavior of transformingMap.
The transformKey method is used to transform keys, similar to the key transformation logic in transformingMap.
The transformValue method is used to transform values, similar to the value transformation logic in transformingMap.
